intro: Sida triloba f. compacta, commonly known as the compact sida, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its small, lobed leaves and pale yellow flowers. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant typically grows in a compact form, with dense foliage that helps it thrive in various environmental conditions. Its botanical features include hairy stems and small, clustered inflorescences. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant due to its hardy nature.
